title: Why Does Israel Keep Having So Many Elections?
description: A divided electorate and shifting alliances make for a delicate balance in the country’s voting outcomes and lawmakers’ ability to hold diverse blocs together.
dc:creator: Patrick Kingsley
media:credit: Avishag Shaar-Yashuv for The New York Times
media:description: Voting during Israel’s parliamentary election at a polling station in Bnei Brak, Israel, on Tuesday.
